questions.neutral: You made it in one piece?

hobby.message: Still dodging towers with those drones?
Found any new political literature lately?
What's your last origami fold say?

wrong_hobby_answer: That's not me - In free time, I fly FPV drones. It's a way to escape the noise of the city.
neutral_answer: Yeah, made it, I guess. Just needed some air.
I've been messing around with some drones, nothing big.
Flew one for a bit tonight, near some old factories.
The signals out there aren't great, but it's manageable.
I wouldn't call it thrilling, more like passing time.
Yeah, in one piece. It’s a good distraction.
You know, I fly drones sometimes just outside the city.
The skies were a bit busy unexpectedly. Just a bit of interference.
It gets my mind off things. Keeps me focused.
Never know who's listening these days, so I keep it light.
Made it, yeah. Needed to unwind a bit.
I’m into pretty niche drone flying, FPV style — first-person view.
I was out by the old industrial zones earlier, flying through the ruins.
Had a weird feed glitch, probably due to recent system issues.
It’s my way to clear my head after long days at work.
Yeah, got here in one piece. Felt like I needed a drink after the evening I had.
I fly drones, FPV flying specifically. You ever heard of it?
It’s a bit like flying a fighter jet with goggles on — pure focus.
Tonight, the feed went glitchy because of some system-level disturbances since Halden's passing.
It's been strange; these little ripple effects are everywhere, even in my downtime.
Flying drones is like meditation with tech — resetting everything before the next workday.
In one piece, but it wasn't without its challenges. Drinks were definitely earned tonight.
I’m always out flying FPV drones when I can — it’s my escape.
Those aerial tricks and navigating through the industrial maze are exhilarating.
Today was rough, though; interference everywhere, ever since everything went awry around Halden's situation.
My feed got buffeted by data waves like never before. It's like everything's subtly unraveling.
Flying lets me disconnect from all these systems — it reminds me I have control somewhere, at least.
hobby_answer: Yeah, drones. I fly them to unwind.
The city’s been messier lately. Hard to find clear spots.
Systems are on edge with Halden gone, that's all.
Drones still fly fine for now.
Just another day, really.
Hey, yeah. Drones keep me sane, for sure.
But frequencies are glitching lately.
Some updates messed around since Halden’s gone.
Noticed changes affecting them, you know?
City feels different above, can’t really say why.
FPV drones are still my break from things, yeah.
The networks have been acting odd though.
Since all that stuff with Halden... yeah, it’s been weird.
Spotty feeds make it tricky, but it's okay mostly.
Always knew things were connected, but it’s more obvious now.
Definitely flying drones keeps me going, Alex.
Lately, I’ve hit interference, even off-grid.
Halden’s death stirred things up, you’ve noticed?
The glitches, they hint that we're all caught in these systems.
It's like I can trace the ripples, even from above.
Oh, Alex, drones are my lifeline these days.
But even out there in those forgotten zones, signals stumble.
Ever since Halden passed, the system feels... off-kilter.
Some days I see my brother’s face in the pixels when the feed breaks.
It’s more than the drones; it’s everything interconnected.
Halden kept us balanced, but now it feels like the city's shuddering.
